title: Château Terres Douces 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a crisp wine, full of acidity. It holds the potential of crisp green and citrus fruits that are developing. A nutty edge contrasts with the tense acidity. Drink from late 2017.

title: Cherry Tart 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Big and flavorful, this full-bodied wine boasts butter, toast and smoke nuances layered over ripe pear and marzipan flavors. Fermented in stainless steel but aged in French oak, it has a rich texture and overt sweetness without going to extremes.

title: Child's Play 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a pretty wine, forward and fruit-driven, with orange-juice highlights around cherry fruit. It's as fresh and flavorful as a Cru Beaujolais, ready for immediate enjoyment and best consumed sometime this decade.

title: Clarendelle 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This lively wine comes from the Clarence Dillon group (Château Haut-Brion). It offers good balance between the considerable acidity and the red-berry fruit. With its spicy background, the wine is delicious to drink now.

title: Claudio Quarta 2016 Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: Made entirely with the native grape Negroamaro, this opens with intriguing aromas of Mediterranean scrub, dill and red berry. The vibrant palate shows sour cherry, strawberry, tangerine and dried herb alongside crisp acidity that lends a refreshing finish.

title: Contrada Salandra 2014 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Citrus zest, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and honey aromas follow over to the refined palate along with yellow apple and a hint of ginger. Bright acidity and a saline note give it a fresh, savory finish.

title: Corte Giacobbe 2016  Soave
description: Aromas of grapefruit and crushed tomato vine lead the nose. The ripe rounded palate offers honeydew melon, lemon drop and a note of crushed dill alongside fresh acidity.

title: Deaver 2016 Chardonnay (Amador County)
description: This fruit-forward wine shows crisp apple and orange blossom aromas and loads of juicy lemon and pineapple flavors. It's full bodied, ultraripe, and lush, albeit a touch sweet and low in acidity.

title: Domaine G. Metz 2016 Melody Riesling (Alsace)
description: A subdued nose has just slight hints of citrus and apple. The palate adds some richer notes of Golden Delicious, tempered with lemon freshness. The body is streamlined, light and dry and has a very refreshing lemony finish.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: A touch of pineapple informs the ripe pear fruit on the nose with extra tropicality. The palate is a little hot and boisterous but the fruit wins through. There is freshness, too, and a dry finish.

title: Hedges 2013 Descendants Liégeois Dupont Les Gosses Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is brooding, with aromas of dark cherry and game. The palate boasts bold fruit and savory flavors along with slightly bunched-up tannins.
designation: Descendants Liégeois Dupont Les Gosses Vineyard

title: Henry Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is an elegant edition of the Henry Estate Pinot Noir. It has shed its rusticity in favor of a delicate expression of varietal character. Crushed rose petals, wild raspberries and a dash of pepper are backed with stiff tannins. Give it another year to fully come together.

title: Henry Estate 2016 Müller-Thurgau (Umpqua Valley)
description: A strength at Henry Estate, this is off dry and lightly fizzy. It's fresh as can be, with just-picked green herbs (cilantro and lemon grass) and tangerine flavors. Drink chilled during the first summer following the vintage.

title: Love That Red 2014 Daily Double Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Franc makes up half this wine, with the balance Cabernet Sauvignon (33%) and Merlot. Plum, blueberry, blackberry and baking-spice aromas lead to a fruit-filled palate with light barrel accents throughout.

title: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Subtle notes of peach rise from the glass and gain full form on the palate where the flavors are boosted by gentle sweetness. The palate is round, fresh and off dry. Drink while aromas are at their peak.

title: Justin 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Sharp lime skin aromas are warmed by Gala apple and wet river stone scents on the nose of this bottling, which blends fruit from warmer eastern vineyards and cooler western ones. It's light in structure and easy to quaff, with searing acidity that carries into the finish. A stony texture frames its honeydew and grapefruit flavors.

title: Parducci 2012 Reserve Port (Mendocino)
description: Sweetness and dried fruit intensity are the hallmarks of this smooth, soft, fortified dessert wine. Raisin and prune aromas dominate the nose while boysenberry and blackberry jam flavors are so rich they coat the tongue and sides of the mouth.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This tart, plush and broadly appealing wine is fruit-forward and rounded with red cherry, cola and vanilla flavors.

title: Muzic 2015 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Here's a big round white that opens with aromas of tropical fruit, hay and wet stone while the ripe full-bodied palate offers cantaloupe and green melon. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol.

title: Fog Crest 2014 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fragrant and floral with exotic figueroa, orange and peach scents, this wine is a feast for the senses, playing out on the palate with high-toned acidity, anise flavor and oak.

title: Pradorey 2010 PR3 Barricas Verdejo (Rueda)
description: This resiny, oaky Verdejo opens with a bright gold luster and spiced pumpkin and honeyed white fruit aromas. Its mature, lightly oxidized stone fruit flavors are backed by lingering toastiness. A full, textured finish closes it out.

title: Primus 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Woodsy earthy black-fruit, raisin and spice-cake aromas are ripe. On the palate, this is chewy, tannic and rubbing. Roasted plum and berry flavors come with notes of toast, chocolate and herbs. A dense grabby finish is solid but a touch hot and rough.

title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2016 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: From his Saint-Émilion base, Bertrand Ravache has created two brands: Leo (for Comte Léo de Malet Roquefort) and Les Hauts. This wine is all fruit, ripe and with a mineral edge. It has lots of acidity, lively fruitiness and hints of spice. Drink this fruity wine now.

title: Maquis 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas come with a distinct and strong whiff of bacon. In the mouth, this is full, angular and highly tannic. A bacon-like flavor leads plum and saucy tomato notes, while this is chunky and scrubbing on the finish, with a flavor of clove.

title: Frédéric Mallo 2015 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Some funk on the nose soon blows off to reveal generously ripe fruit of yellow pear. The palate benefits from a touch of flavor-boosting residual sweetness but the finish is dry. This is full fruited and balanced. Drink while flavors are at their peak.

title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2016 Cuvée Meline White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Sémillon (55%) and Sauvignon Blanc from Cave B and Mercer Estate vineyards. Aromas are reticent at present, with notes of reduction, grass, herb and spice. The palate is flavorful, with citrus and tropical-fruit flavors. It delivers a lot of enjoyment.

title: Liberty Lake 2012 Heritage Reserve Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is a blend of 50% Syrah aged for 40 months in new American oak, with the other half Cabernet Sauvignon aged in new Slovakian oak. Aromas of cardamom, green pepper, cherry, vanilla and anise are followed by abundant baking-spice accents backed by tart fruit flavors. Barrel notes take over the finish.

title: Lincourt 2014 Steel Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Crisp and citrusy lime peel, grapefruit pith, orange and nectarine aromas show in this stainless steel-aged bottling. The palate is more botanical in nature, showing chive and dill along with underripe Bosc pear and key lime flavors. The texture is quite grippy.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2012 Cunat Reserve Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: Given extra time in bottle, this reserve-tier wine offers a generous layering of chocolate and blueberry flavor, the tannins soft and pillowy. Simple in its rich coconut and leather tones, it finishes without fuss.

title: Kovács Nimród 2012 Monopole Rhapsody Red (Eger)
description: This Hungarian red blend is garnet in color, with aromas of red cherry and black berry and flavors of red cherry and pomegranate. The tannins are soft with a medium-length finish.
